sac.examples.tsp

Class MinimumSpanningTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • sac.examples.tsp.MinimumSpanningTree

  • public class MinimumSpanningTree
extends java.lang.Object
    Minimum Spanning Tree solver via Kruskal's algorithm, used in TSP as heuristics.
    Author:
    Przemysław Klęsk (wi.zut.edu.pl), Marcin Korzeń (wi.zut.edu.pl)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MinimumSpanningTree(MinimumSpanningTree toCopy)
      Creates a new instance of minimum spanning tree as a copy.
      MinimumSpanningTree(java.util.SortedSet<Place> places)
      Creates a minimum spanning tree from a collection of places.

      Returns the connections.

      Returns the cost of this minimum spanning tree.

      Checks if a given place is associated with only one connection in this minimum spanning tree.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MinimumSpanningTree

        public MinimumSpanningTree(MinimumSpanningTree toCopy)
        Creates a new instance of minimum spanning tree as a copy.
        Parameters:
        toCopy - minimum spanning tree to be copied

      • MinimumSpanningTree

        public MinimumSpanningTree(java.util.SortedSet<Place> places)
        Creates a minimum spanning tree from a collection of places. The Kruskal's algorithm is performed inside this constructor.
        Parameters:
        places - collection of places (as a SortedSet).

    • Method Detail

      • getConnections

        public java.util.List<Connection> getConnections()
        Returns the connections.
        Returns:
        connections

      • getCost

        public double getCost()
        Returns the cost of this minimum spanning tree.
        Returns:
        cost of this minimum spanning tree

      • setCost

        public void setCost(double cost)
        Explicitly sets the cost of this minimum spanning tree. This method may be useful in case some simple modifications from outside (e.g. removal of some connection) are made on this tree, and its cost is the recalculated in a control manner.
        Parameters:
        cost - new cost to be set

      • isPlaceWithSingleConnection

        public Connection isPlaceWithSingleConnection(Place place)
        Checks if a given place is associated with only one connection in this minimum spanning tree. If so the connection is returned, otherwise a null is returned.
        Parameters:
        place - reference to given place
        Returns:
        single connection or null if more than one connection exists
